places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Regency
address: B-49, Mac Donald Hill, Zarkawt, Aizawl, Mizoram 796007, India

reviews.text:
Most third class quality hotel. No value for money. They will provide you small single bedrooms instead of double room price.
Good quality is worst. No service at buffet. No person will be there to serve. Foods will be kept insufficient in breakfast.
Don't go for this hotel.
Probably among the best hotels in Aizawl. Had a really good experience. The staff are excellent and the restaurant serves fantastic food.

I am not a usual guy who gives a review. When something different happens it matters. I always travel around and stay at good hotels. I was amazed by the efficiency of service and politeness and readiness to do things here. They treat you with a personal touch. Amazing. I have no say for the room as it never served the purpose. But yes the service O got never got me to think of my room. Room was good just 2 single beds instead of a king size. I checked in as 2 adults and 1 child. I still never understood why I got 2 single bed. My son fell of many times from the bed while sleeping as he had to sleep with one of us in a single bed. Otherwise amazing.

Food was not up to the mark. Below average taste including breakfast items served cold. Service was professional but the friendly personal touch was missing. The hotel is usually full and hence the overall attitude of the staff was on a "take it or leave it" lines.

Rooms were clean but the overall quality was not of the type one expects from a supposed top ranked hotel in the city.

Supposed to be the best place to stay in aizawl, breakfast should improve a lot for the charges they are levying, never go for non ac rooms which are the only ones available at makemytrip, better call them and check it out. They need to improve a lot and their staff needs to work on ensuring better customer service. The house keeping also needs to improve, the bathrooms stink and they need to work upon the same.

preprocessed_reviews: third class quality hotel value money provide small single bedrooms instead double room price good quality worst service buffet person serve foods kept insufficient breakfast dont go hotel
probably among best hotels aizawl really good experience staff excellent restaurant serves fantastic food

places_with_reviews.name: Aizawl Guest House
address: PHE Bill Pekna Bul, Laipuitlang Rd, Laipuitlang, Aizawl, Mizoram 796001, India

reviews.text: Very bad service. I stayed for 2 days. Every morning I have to asked for hot water and they are unable to give.They always switch off Geyser intentionally. Very bad food. Only bread and egg, and 1  Banana in their breakfast. Moreover surprisingly  they charged security deposit when a person goes their, even after paying the all bill in advance. My company has already make payment but when I reached hotel , they are asking for Rs. 2000 as security deposit. And they also asked to me go other places if I am unable to pay the deposit. Very rude behaviour. Don't go that place, it is outskirt of the city.

This property has great views from the rooms with balcony. But everything else is below par.  Maintenance and food are very poor. Old room where we stayed for dirt three nights are not fit for staying by any standards.Newly built upper rooms are so cramped that we couldn’t sleep till the next door guests went silent after 11 pm.

The free breakfast is a joke. No varieties. Stuff doesn’t bother to clean the tables in the so called dining room where you must go for the breakfast.

We stayed here for three times - a total of five nights. Honestly, we would have looked for other options if all of our are bookings were not pre-paid and refundable.

We booked our stays considering the review scores on various platforms. It was a big time mistake.

We failed to understand if this place is hotel or a homestay. It has no convenience if a hotel and no warmth of a home stay.

Just Amazing!! Mary was such a gem of a person. Always greeting with a smile and ready to help whenever you call her. I had booked a long stay in short intervals as I had to travel the whole of Mizoram for 15 days and she took care of my stay at Aizawl. The rooms provided were just amazing, I got a rooms with stunning Birds Eye view of Aizawl city get and your own Oven, Gas stove, washing machine and fridge along with eatables like Chips, Wai-wai, juice and biscuits . Clean rooms with superb beds and spick and span washrooms. They provide pick up and drop from airport along with cab service for site seeing. Definitely recommending others when in Aizawl. Keep it up Mary🫡
I have stayed more than 2 days. For family members it's really wonderful. You all can feel like home.

My second stay, this year, at this property. From the time that I had first visited in July, I noticed a lot of improvement in infrastructure. Ms. Mary Anne, the Manager of the property has achieved wonders in a short span of time. The new wing is very beautiful.

Don't expect star category service because you aren't paying for it. Rooms and bathrooms are spotless clean. Mary Anne is still in the process of streamlining the ancillary services like tours and drivers, etc.

Out of the 4 drivers who were at our service (airport pickup, city tour 1, city tour 2, airport drop), two were absolute gems, one was a cheating rogue and one was a sweet, well mannered and not too knowledgeable kid. Ask for Mr. David, he is brilliant driver and guide.

I would advise guests to exercise patience and treat the hotel staff with respect to get the best out of them. If you don't speak Mizo, please speak English or Hindi with the staff, slowly.

Please remember that this is a guest house and not a hotel and facilities are limited. However, the amenities will improve over time. Some rooms are equipped with Microwave ovens, gas cooking stove, all utensils, etc. You may opt for these rooms if you wish to get things as per your schedule and convenience. This, being a guest house, has its own rules and timings which may not be convenient for all.

I experienced wonderful service from Ms. Mary Anne and her elderly aunt (who is the owner of the property). This lady went out of her way, despite her advanced age, to keep me happy and meet my personal requests for Dragon fruit, Passion fruit and Avocados. It is not something that every property owner will do.

To sum up, if you want a spectacular view of Aizawl and if you like the sound of children laughing and playing - stay at this property and you won't regret it.

places_with_reviews.name: Royale Lalawi Hotel
address: House No: D, 7, Khatla, Aizawl, Mizoram 796001, India

reviews.text: I stayed 40 days in this hotel and will love to come back again. Had a room with a great view. One that you can live with for 40 days and cherish. The rooms are very cozy with full floor carpeting. The rooms are big and the linen is absolutely fresh. It’s absolutely neat and clean. The staff is young but very courteous and helpful. I became friends with most. The breakfast is decent.

The place has poor parking space. The place has no lift and you have to carry all the bags from the road to their reception which is almost two floors.  Then they have a lift which is a matchbox and only fits 3-5 pax max and no bags.  Room's were ok.  Breakfast spread was sufficient however service was slow and there were almost no refills for hot items or even juices and fruits.

It is a good 3 star hotel. For its class and promise, it delivers value for money. Good clean rooms, good food, friendly staff and well located within Aizawl. Rooms offer great views of cloud swept hills. Enjoyed the stay.

Excellent in all respect. One experience stands out which I would like to share.  I hired a car from the hotel to drop me to Airport. While getting down at Airport I forgot to take my selfie-stick and left it in the car. After 10-15 minutes I realised and called up the hotel reception informing about it. The driver came back in search for me and handed over the selfie-stick. Thank you Hotel Royale Lalawi.

The Building and Location is good.. let's point out the worst part
1) some of the staff always drunk and smell like  Shikar , smoke
2) The restaurant staff doesn't behave well becuz they talk in a very loud voice in a counter area
3) Restaurant wash room next to the kitchen was soooo freaking  dirty , even Guest  & Staff are sharing The same wash/ rest room
4) Restaurant table cloth was soooo dirty , they should remove the cloth because the table without cover look more good & Classy
5) restaurant staff grooming was not up to the mark especially Girls .
6) Restaurant was sooo dirty ,, I think HK never clean the restaurant.
7) For senior citizens better not stay in this hotel , the elevator and Lobby was on 2nd Floor . Taking stairs when you are tired and not feeling  will makes you  uncomfortable & dizzy
8) kitchen Service was toooo slow ..... During my stay I always have food outside ...
9) HK performance is not very good , stairs are not cleaned , My room HK service was very unprofessional.
10) Owner family & relatives are more important than the Guest ...( as I heard from some staff , they need give VVIP service to owner and their relatives and friends.)

Lastly I never recommend this hotel if you want a good service...... Room was good for to stay ... But Kitchen , restaurant,Hk service was not good...

places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Dinthar Zara
address: DT-12, Zawlphei St, beside Taxi Stand, Dinthar Veng, Aizawl, Mizoram 796001, India

reviews.text: This is one of the nicest hotels that I have stayed in, mainly because of the stunning views and newly constructed, clean and tidy rooms. Breakfast is also complimentary and the taxi stand is also nearby. Overall, it is a very nice budget accommodation in Aizawl. Highly recommended.
Had a wonderful stay here. Fine quality food and welcoming staff.
It's a good hotel, staff is very hepful, kitchen is very neat and clean, rooms are very good, food is good, view from there is very good.
Spent some wonderful time here in Aizawl. Wonderful staff with amazing view of city.

I had a wonderful experience at Hotel Dinthar Zara. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive to my needs!. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, providing a peaceful and relaxing stay. The food at the on-site restaurant was delicious, and the service was exceptional. The hotel's location is perfect for exploring the city, with many popular sites and attractions within walking distance. Its a great place to stay during their travels."

places_with_reviews.name: Emerald Hotel

reviews.text:
Dear Emerald Te am,

I recently had the pleasure of staying at your hotel, and overall, my experience was positive. The cleanliness of the rooms and common areas was commendable, and the staff had to improve a little bit in professionalism but the friendliness was outstanding

I appreciated the variety of amenities offered. However, I would suggest the room services(Glass Water Bottle to change continuously)and F&B Team(Serving period)to improvement as it could enhance the overall guest experience.

Thank you for a pleasant stay, and I look forward to considering your hotel for future visits.

Best regards,
Biaklawma

Stayed in a ‘double room’ which was decent but on the smaller side. The room had a new 55 inch tv which doesn’t work. However, service needs much more improvement, there was no hot water in shower. Staff is hospitable but needs more training to be professional. Coming to food, had a mixed experience at the restaurant. Staff is excellent but they take long time to serve food. Chinese and continental items are better than the Indian section. Breakfast served was skeletal.

Pros:
Rooms were vey clean.
Food here was very tasty and hygiene.
Near to many government offices.
Staff is very cooperative and helpful.
Cons:
If you want to enjoy TV then wifi should be available. Because sometimes this wifi goes down.
Breakfast had very little options.
No good view from room (except few rooms)

DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL! I specifically called ahead to ask about the family suite. On the website it says it allows 4 adults and 2 children. I asked how many beds the room comes and was told it had 2 beds. I booked the room and upon arrival was shown the room that only has 1 king bed inside and a sitting room separate. They said I could get an extra mattress on the floor for a fee. The room was so dirty and still under construction. The floor was covered in black filth that left our feet so dirty. The shower drain was completely plugged and no flow. No hotel slippers were provided. No hot water kettle was provided. No table was provided. For 9,000 ruppee a night, I expected far more. I found worms and other insects in the bathroom. There was no accomodations provided by management for the complete inadequate room provided. The entire staff needs retraining in international hotel hospitality. Rooms need to have the highest standard of cleaning.

it's a decent hotel the location is great,  rooms are fine and pretty decent as well. The staffs are good and easy to interact with, appreciate their efforts for showing kindness and love towards their customers as it can be seen through their  actions but the hotel maintenance is bad and the manager should take a quick action in fixing the geezer because it's cold now. Overall it's fine

It was nice and all except for the road leading to the resort.
Nice place, but road

places_with_reviews.name: The Grand Hotel
address: G-47, Chanmari, Opposite To KFC, Zarkawt, Aizawl, Mizoram 796001, India

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 days, hotel is located in a prime location, good connectivity to other places through two & four wheeler taxis. Service is very good, hotel staff is very polite & helpful. Food is little costly but tasty. As for as rooms it's comfortable for the budget, though the lift is small but one person can fit along with his luggage.

This property is very comfortable and located close to main market. Rooms are very neat and clean. Staff are courteous and visitor friendly. Their complimentary breakfast options are good and food is tasty. Alu Paratha and Chole bhatura is very good. Kid friendly hotel with lift facility. Opposite KFC and 2 mins walk to museum. Best hotel for all types of travellers. Airport drop and pick up is there. Special discounts for solo travellers and bloggers.

Location is real good....close to shopping. Room was bad, especially the bathroom. the bathroom window was half broken. The toilet side of the bathroom was dirty. Most of all, water supply is not consistent. They close the Front Desk at 10 PM; don't open till 6:00 AM. They rent rooms to single guys for only Rs. 1000 per person per night; they are extremely noisy. On January 23 night they made noise, were loud with music and talk till 3:00AM. NO ONE FROM THE HOTEL SAYS ANYTHING. In other words, THOSE SINGLE GUYS ARE LICENSED TO BE LOUD!!!

Rooms are ok. Try to check it before you check it. It is a hilly place so there are chances of lack of water in the night time , so, it is advisable to keep one bucket of water full in the bathroom. Food is some are very good and some are not upto the mark especially the veg items. Food is little costly side. Complementary breakfast you can chose any two eatable and any two beverages.Lift space is very small. But location is too prime for hang arounds and check out.

This was my first visit to Grand Hotel Aizawl. No doubt it's Good and Affordable. Rooms are clean, bed sheets, pillows are clean too, we don't feel HIZZZ to sleep like some other hotels. Love it. My next visit for sure. Very important free Wifi n free Breakfast that feels great. Thank you for your service G.H. staffs.

places_with_reviews.name: Berawtlang Tourist Centre

reviews.text: Clean and friendly natural environment. Got a beautiful view point. But it's a little bit of a  scary place because of high altitude and both sides direct down.
Location is very nice but maintenance is a big issue.

This tourist centre is environmental friendly but it is far from aizawl city which is around 10 to 12km .Zero noise pollution unlike aizawl and other main town. Visitor will find a nice a nice view at night beside the dinning room .Apart of that explore yourself  further good luck to all the visitor  👍👍
We used to come here with tons of friends for parties or just to hangout. Aaaaaa the good old days 😆😆
Location is great. Food is good. You can book online @Mizoram tourism

places_with_reviews.name: The Esquire
address: D-51, Sikulpuikawn, Mission Veng, Republic Veng, Aizawl, Mizoram 796005, India

reviews.text: One of the worst hotel, no value for money. Rooms are smelling and dirty with torn linen. Seepage marks all over. I was on single occupancy and given a twin bed room.No exhaust in bathroom. Service is something you can't expect from this hotel. Staff is very rude. They have placed notices everywhere that outside food is not allowed. However,  when I called to give the order for dinner,  they were like chef is on leave and you can have your dinner outside. Breakfast is another disaster you will get 2 slice of bread and 1 omellete that's it and that too was not provided since the chef was unavailable. Complete waste of money.  Never book this hotel.
One of the worst hotel ever. Poor services. Very rude staff. Dirty rooms. Torn linen. Food quality is worst. Never book this hotel. No value for money.
Cosy place with OK rooms. Good food and good service. Affordable prices

The Esquire is a fantastic hotel that offers a perfect blend of comfort and luxury. The rooms are spacious, elegantly furnished, and equipped with modern amenities that cater to your every need. The hotel staff is friendly, courteous, and always ready to assist you with anything you need, making for a pleasant and comfortable stay. The hotel's restaurant serves delicious food that caters to all tastes, and the breakfast spread is particularly impressive. The location is also great, with easy access to many local attractions. Overall, The Esquire is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a luxurious and comfortable stay in Aizawl. Highly recommended!

I loved this hotel

Excellent, neat and clean room including bathroom. good and tasty food, beyond my expectations.  Value for money.

Very friendly staaf, Environment is too good Firstly prime location, secondly food quality is very good, thirdly hotel rooms are very clean all furniture is decorative neatly arranged, & lastly the working staff is co-operative, and expert with prompt service. Really very excellent hotel for stay

I do recommend this hotel. Worth it.

places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Platinum Zarkawt
address: upper Before Trinity diagnostic, MacDonald Hill, Zarkawt, Aizawl, Mizoram 796001, India

reviews.text: Really nice place to dine in. Ambience excellent. Food is best among available options. Both veg and non veg served here. Staff is courteous. The best part of this restaurant is that all the dishes are tasty and reasonably priced.

This hotel is at Aizawl, Mizoram. Hotel environment is very nice. Rooms are good. Resturent is at 2nd floor. Variety of food6is available. North Indian food is also available in this resturent. Fish items are very tasty. Maintain proper cleanliness at hotel rooms. Staffs can speak English and hindi both. Good for family also. The view of Aizawl from this hotel is beautiful.

A calming experience.

I visited it at noon on a weekday and I am impressed by the vibe and calming effect that the restaurant had even during the day.
A must visit, a must taste, and a must stay.
Situated at the heart of Aizawl, Zarkawt Lane. Rooms are pretty decent with complementary breakfast. Hotel is quite accessible from the main road.
Good place ..very tasty food..nice place for get together for friends..
